speaker: Shani Adadi Kazaz
talk: Kubernetes as a Platform: From infrastructure as code to API-driven infrastructure
description: Discover how leveraging Kubernetes for platform engineering can dramatically increase development efficiency, streamline operations, and enable unprecedented scale through Kubernetes-native GitOps. This session explores how the Kubernetes API becomes the cornerstone of GitOps practices, solving key challenges in managing cloud resources and infrastructure at scale. Learn how this Kubernetes-centric approach transforms traditional workflows, allowing teams to declaratively manage thousands of resources across complex environments using familiar Kubernetes objects and methodologies. We'll demonstrate how platform abstractions help overcome complex challenges, and how automation aligns with Kubernetes controllers principles using open-source tools. Explore how the powerful combination of Kro, ArgoCD, and ACK extends the Kubernetes API to drive GitOps for both applications and infrastructure, revolutionizing platform engineering on EKS through a truly Kubernetes-native GitOps approach.

speaker: Gisela Torres

¬øY si te dijera que hay una forma de liberar a los equipos del caos operativo y adem√°s self-service?

speaker: Alberto Morgante
talk: Automated Baremetal deployment with CAPI + ClusterClass
description:
As Kubernetes adoption grows beyond the cloud into data centers and edge environments, provisioning clusters on bare metal becomes increasingly crucial. However, deploying and managing these environments at scale remains a complex challenge.

This session will explore how Cluster API (CAPI) combined with ClusterClass can be leveraged to fully automate the lifecycle of Kubernetes clusters on bare metal infrastructure. Attendees will learn how to eliminate manual provisioning, enforce cluster consistency, and reduce operational toil using modern GitOps-driven workflows.

We'll walk through a real-world, end-to-end implementation that includes:

Setting up a CAPI provider for bare metal (e.g., Metal3)

Using ClusterClass to define standardized cluster templates

Integrating with Ironic for node provisioning

Automating updates, scaling, and lifecycle management

Best practices for security, HA, and extensibility in bare metal scenarios

Whether you're operating edge clusters, hybrid environments, or building your own metal cloud, this talk will give you the tools to make bare metal Kubernetes feel as dynamic and elastic as the cloud.

speaker: Pablo S√°nchez Carmona

description: Descubre c√≥mo adoptar una mentalidad DevSecOps transforma la protecci√≥n de la infraestructura en AWS de un cuello de botella en una ventaja competitiva, permitiendo a los equipos desplegar de forma segura siendo √°giles y escalables. Esta sesi√≥n explora la intersecci√≥n cr√≠tica entre automatizaci√≥n, infraestructura como c√≥digo (IaC) y cultura DevOps en la gesti√≥n de entornos complejos. Examinaremos c√≥mo las organizaciones gestionan exitosamente miles de recursos en AWS en entornos multi-cuenta sin sacrificar seguridad ni frenar la innovaci√≥n. Exploraremos estrategias pr√°cticas para implementar pol√≠ticas como c√≥digo, validaci√≥n autom√°tica de requisitos de seguridad y red, y monitoreo continuo de la infraestructura. Al final de esta sesi√≥n, queremos que te lleves patrones accionables para construir infraestructura que pueda crecer de forma segura junto con tus necesidades de negocio, demostrando que seguridad y velocidad no son conceptos opuestos cuando haces "shift left" y "scale right".

speaker: Antonio Berben, Felipe Vicens
talk: De Becario en formaci√≥n a Agente √âpico. Evoluci√≥n de la IA en Infraestructuras Cr√≠ticas Seguras
description:
La inteligencia artificial ha evolucionado hacia agentes aut√≥nomos capaces de colaborar y operar a escala en infraestructura cr√≠tica.

Al ver el t√≠tulo, tu pregunta es ineludible: ¬øc√≥mo paso de simple becario a Modo Dios de forma segura con los Agentes de AI?

Con proyectos open source como AgentGateway, Kgateway, KAgent y LLM-D como referencia, exploraremos el papel esencial de los gateways seguros y la colaboraci√≥n agent-to-agent (A2A) en arquitecturas distribuidas, que permiten mantener la integridad y la protecci√≥n en sistemas ag√©nticos complejos.

Entenderemos por qu√© la seguridad y la escalabilidad son pilares fundamentales para el futuro de los agentes aut√≥nomos en infraestructuras cr√≠ticas.

speaker: Carlos Villan√∫a
talk: $Git It Done: API Management as Code (The DevOps & Platform Team Dream)
description:
Puede ser en Espa√±ol o Ingl√©s y puede ser de 30 minutos o 50 minutos. Ser√° una introducci√≥n y live demo.

¬øTodav√≠a expones tus APIs de forma manual, con poca seguridad ( o la seguridad en la propia API...) o siempre apagando fuegos? Esta charla es para ti.

Voy a mostrarte c√≥mo exponer APIs puede ser f√°cil para los equipos DevOps y seguro para los desarrolladores, usando una plataforma que es totalmente Infra as Code, sin configuraciones manuales (ClickOps), y pensada para ser r√°pida, segura y escalable.

¬øQu√© vas a aprender (y por qu√© esto es el sue√±o de cualquier equipo DevOps o de plataforma)?

-Infra as Code total: Todo: APIs, pol√≠ticas, infraestructura y seguridad est√° en Git. As√≠ puedes probar, revisar y desplegar todo autom√°ticamente con CI/CD.

-Automatizaci√≥n nativa en Kubernetes: Usamos herramientas como Traefik, CRDs y GitHub para hacer verdadero GitOps. Puedes desplegar, actualizar o revertir APIs sin necesidad de usar interfaces gr√°ficas.

-Seguridad flexible: OPA y Keycloak para pol√≠ticas y autenticaci√≥n, WAF y Content Guards para proteger tus APIs. As√≠ los desarrolladores se enfocan en el c√≥digo, no en problemas de cumplimiento.

-Gateway Offloading: La plataforma se encarga de la autenticaci√≥n, l√≠mites de uso, seguridad y monitoreo. Tus servicios quedan limpios y simples.

-Observabilidad completa: Grafana Loki, Tempo, y Jaeger te dan visibilidad total para detectar y resolver problemas antes que los usuarios los noten.

No m√°s excusas, no m√°s configuraciones manuales. Solo c√≥digo, automatizaci√≥n y tranquilidad.

Once you have converted the application, you will learn to deploy it on Graviton infrastructure through Amazon EKS or Autoscaling Groups.

speaker: Carlos Polop
talk: GCP Vulnerabilities & Features of Offensive Engineers
description:
Over the past years, I have conducted extensive research into how attackers can exploit various features of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Google Workspace to escalate privileges, maintain persistence, and execute post-exploitation actions. This work has uncovered numerous behaviors that hold significant value for Red Teams. While some of these findings have prompted GCP to implement fixes, others have been acknowledged as inherent features of the platform. Key discoveries include:

- Methods to perform critical actions without generating audit logs.

- Exploiting environment variables to achieve remote code execution (RCE) on systems and containers that are not intended to be directly accessible.

- Techniques for pivoting from Google Cloud Storage buckets to other GCP services and Service Accounts.

- Leveraging containers to establish "invisible" persistence mechanisms.

Additionally, my research has focused on understanding and exploiting the behaviour of Google‚Äôs enterprise tools, such as:

- Google Credential Provider for Windows

- Google Cloud Directory Sync

- Google Password Sync

- Admin Directory Sync

These tools can be used to pivot and escalate privileges from environments like Windows, Active Directory, and Microsoft Entra ID into Google Workspace, ultimately gaining access to GCP.

speaker: Dachi Gogotchuri

En esta sesi√≥n pr√°ctica, exploraremos c√≥mo automatizar la generaci√≥n de pipelines CI/CD que cumplan autom√°ticamente con los est√°ndares corporativos, utilizando plantillas inteligentes y an√°lisis predictivo de c√≥digo.

Aprender√°s a implementar un sistema que interpreta cambios en pull requests, predice problemas de calidad y seguridad, y garantiza el cumplimiento normativo de forma proactiva. Veremos como documentar pol√≠ticas para que la IA tome decisiones coherentes sobre advertencias y errores.

speaker: Juan Vicente Herrera Ruiz de Alejo

La charla tambi√©n aborda amenazas reales en entornos de ML, como el envenenamiento de datos y los ataques adversariales, y propone pr√°cticas de dise√±o seguro para equipos que trabajan sobre OpenShift AI.

speaker: Ignacio Dominguez
talk: Hacking CI/CD Pipelines
description:
English:

This hands-on workshop dives into the security risks hiding in modern CI/CD pipelines. You‚Äôll learn how attackers target misconfigurations and weak spots across code repositories, build systems, and deployment workflows. We'll cover real-world attack paths and exploitation techniques using GitHub Actions, Terraform, AWS, Kubernetes, and GitOps tools like ArgoCD. Expect practical insights, demos, and a focus on breaking things to understand how to better defend them.

Agenda:

1. Introduction and CI/CD concepts

2. Poisoned Pipeline Execution

3. Lateral movement to/from Cloud environments (AWS)

4. GitOps - Lateral movement to Kubernetes (ArgoCD)

5. Exploiting GHA Self-Hosted Runners

6. Supply Chain attacks

Espa√±ol:

Este taller pr√°ctico se enfoca en los riesgos de seguridad que se esconden en los pipelines modernos de CI/CD. Aprender√°s c√≥mo los atacantes aprovechan malas configuraciones y puntos d√©biles en repositorios de c√≥digo, sistemas de build y flujos de despliegue. Veremos rutas de ataque reales y t√©cnicas de explotaci√≥n usando GitHub Actions, Terraform, AWS, Kubernetes y herramientas de GitOps como ArgoCD. Prep√°rate para demos, ejemplos pr√°cticos y romper cosas para entender c√≥mo defenderlas mejor.

Agenda:

1. Introducci√≥n y conceptos de CI/CD

2. Ejecuci√≥n envenenada del pipeline (Poisoned Pipeline Execution)

3. Movimiento lateral hacia/desde entornos en la nube (AWS)

4. GitOps ‚Äì Movimiento lateral hacia Kubernetes (ArgoCD)

5. Explotaci√≥n de runners auto-hospedados en GitHub Actions

6. Ataques a la cadena de suministro (Supply Chain Attacks)

speaker: Jeff Fan
talk: Stop Treating LLMs as a RESTful API
description: Why do PoCs run smoothly while launch day implodes? Because LLM traffic is a streaming, state-heavy beast that breaks every REST assumption: requests aren‚Äôt stateless, payloads snowball with context, and GPU memory melts under token floods. We‚Äôll map the three checkpoints where most projects stall‚Äîcontext explosion, batch backfires, cache chaos‚Äîand show how LLM-D‚Äôs open-source sharding plus a hybrid NVIDIA/AMD node pool turns each choke point into a green light. You‚Äôll see live before-and-after dashboards, get a YAML ladder you can drop into any cluster, and learn a back-of-the-napkin formula to keep cost per 1 000 tokens under control.

speaker: Jose G√≥mez-Sell√©s
talk: Scale Your Monitoring Solution With the VictoriaMetrics Ecosystem
description: When it comes down to scaling time series monitoring solutions things can get messy. That‚Äôs one of the reasons why VictoriaMetrics, a Silver member of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF), started its journey some years ago. It is a simple, reliable and efficient set of Observability Solutions that's been adopted by many organizations. It's open source, with a strong community behind it, with enterprise and managed (Cloud) options for those who need support. VictoriaMetrics plays well with many standards, including Grafana and OpenTelemetry. Apart from that, in case you didn‚Äôt know, VictoriaLogs is the new kid in the block that's seriously outperforming other solutions. In this presentation, we‚Äôll present the VictoriaMetrics Open Source projects and how they differ from other solutions, especially when it comes to scaling from single small setups to massive cluster deployments.Come learn how VictoriaMetrics projects can help to ease Observability!

In the era of DevOps and continuous integration/deployment (CI/CD), automating database operations is critical for maintaining agile and efficient development workflows. This technical session provides a deep dive into the integration of Oracle DB Operator for Kubernetes, GitHub Actions, and Liquibase to streamline and automate database CI/CD pipelines.

The session will also cover schema versioning and database changes using Liquibase, ensuring that database deployments are consistent, reliable, and easily manageable. Join us to learn how to revolutionize your CI/CD processes, enhance productivity, and achieve seamless database operations in a multi-cloud environment.

speaker: Jos√© Enrique Calder√≥n Sanz

By the end of this talk, you'll gain a profound understanding of the significance of decision-making in shaping robust architectures and walk away with a practical toolkit of best practices‚Äîinspired by Gaudi's methodology‚Äîto effectively manage and document your architectural decisions.

speaker: Alberto Lobato
talk: Ciberseguridad y OT. ¬øFriends or enemies?
description: Los entornos de Tecnolog√≠a Operativa (OT) est√°n omnipresentes en nuestra vida diaria, desde los sistemas de control de los trenes que tomamos cada ma√±ana, hasta la infraestructura energ√©tica que alimenta nuestros hogares y los procesos industriales que producen los bienes que consumimos. Estos entornos son cr√≠ticos para el funcionamiento de nuestra sociedad y, por lo tanto, su seguridad es de vital importancia.En esta charla, exploraremos los desaf√≠os espec√≠ficos de la ciberseguridad en entornos OT y c√≥mo difiere de la ciberseguridad convencional en entornos de Tecnolog√≠a de la Informaci√≥n (IT). Analizaremos las particularidades de la ciberseguridad OT, incluyendo los riesgos y amenazas √∫nicos que enfrentan estos sistemas.A trav√©s de ejemplos concretos de proyectos y ofertas reales en los que he trabajado como experto en ciberseguridad en el sector ferroviario, ilustrar√© el proceso de implementaci√≥n de medidas de seguridad efectivas conforme a la normativa IEC 62443. Esta charla ofrecer√° una visi√≥n pr√°ctica y experta sobre c√≥mo proteger los entornos OT cr√≠ticos y garantizar la resiliencia de nuestra infraestructura industrial.
